vibe.label: Defensive Rotation Underway
vibe.desc: Money rotating from growth (-3.7% vs SPY) into defensive sectors (Utilities +8.7%, Staples +7.7% vs SPY). Institutions hedging, not fully exiting equities.

yield_curve.interpretation_text: Steepening — banks earning more on loans vs deposits. Bullish for XLF.

hy_spread.regime_text: HY spreads very tight — investors accepting minimal extra yield for junk risk. Risk-on.

economic_calendar.watch_note: Watch core services, not headline. Shelter costs key.
New orders sub-index is the forward-looking read.
Wage growth (hourly earnings) matters as much as the headline.

economic_calendar.sector_risk: All sectors — primary rate pivot driver
economic_calendar.watch_note: Core services ex-shelter is the Fed's focus metric.
Watch dot plot revision + 'higher for longer' vs 'data dependent' language.

items.headline: TJ Maxx parent’s earnings show discount clothes and home goods are still in high demand
items.summary: TJ Maxx parent company TJX reported a triple beat with its fourth-quarter results on Wednesday, but shares of the off-price apparel and home-fashions retailer slipped as the outlook disappointed.
items.one_line: TJX discount retail strength suggests consumer resilience despite macro headwinds.

items.headline: HSBC reports a beat and a raise as it leapfrogs Wells Fargo by market cap
items.summary: HSBC’s guidance for 2026 is pushing analysts to raise their stock-price estimates by around 6%
items.one_line: HSBC beats and raises; outperforms Wells Fargo on profitability and valuation.

items.headline: Small caps’ ‘recovery’ is a myth built on unprofitable stocks. Here’s what history says happens next.
items.summary: The Russell Microcap Index is surging — yet 57% of its members lost money last year. That never ends well.
items.one_line: Small-cap rally driven by unprofitable stocks; warns of mean-reversion risk.

items.headline: Circle gives crypto investors a reason to cheer by reporting a big jump in profits
items.summary: Circle Internet’s stock soars, as the stablecoin issuer reported a big jump in fourth-quarter profitability.
items.one_line: Circle crypto-profit surge; positive signal for digital asset adoption thesis.

items.headline: Lowe’s shares dip after home-improvement retailer warns of ‘ongoing uncertainty’ in category
items.one_line: LOW dips on guidance warning despite beats; signals housing market uncertainty.

items.headline: Lowe's earnings beat as sales jump more than 10% despite sluggish housing market
items.summary: Lowe's posted more than 10% sales growth in the fourth quarter at a time when housing turnover and home improvement demand are slow.
items.one_line: LOW beats earnings and sales; contradicts headline #9 on market weakness.

items.headline: HP blames memory-price surge as it forecasts earnings at low end of guidance
items.summary: Computer maker HP blamed the surge in memory chip prices as it forecast earnings for the year to come in at the low end of previously issued guidance.
items.one_line: HPQ misses on memory-price headwinds; signals tech input cost inflation.

items.headline: The milestones keep coming for the world’s hottest stock market
items.summary: Exports are booming, the currency is improving and the government is pursuing a very ambitious program of reform to boost the stock market. And it’s working.
items.one_line: Emerging market strength; positive risk-on signal for global equities.

items.headline: The maker of Taser stun guns says it’s becoming an AI company as bookings surge
items.summary: Axon Enterprises stock jumped on Wednesday, as the maker of Taser stun guns said its efforts at providing artificial intelligence-driven services to law enforcement clients have led to bookings.
items.one_line: AXON pivot to AI with strong bookings; supports tech/defense narrative.

items.headline: American tequila sales are collapsing. Diageo is cutting its dividend in half.
items.summary: Diageo on Wednesday said it was cutting its dividend in half as it reduced its sales outlook, citing American consumer reluctance to spend due to affordability concerns.
items.one_line: Tequila sales collapse; Diageo DGE dividend cut signals consumer weakness.

items.headline: Trump backs stock-trade ban for Congress during State of the Union. Here’s where the effort stands.
items.summary: President Donald Trump got applause from Democrats and Republicans alike when he called in his State of the Union address for Congress to stop insider trading among lawmakers.
items.one_line: Trump backs congressional stock-trade ban; potential regulatory shift on equities.

items.headline: Workday’s stock dives as earnings reveal the cost of competing in AI
items.summary: Workday’s margin outlook came up short of expectations as the company steps up AI investments.
items.one_line: WDAY stock dives; AI competition costs erode margins, questions profitability.

items.headline: Nvidia’s earnings report is just a prelude to what should really matter for investors
items.summary: The chip maker’s results are unlikely to be much of a catalyst for the stock as investors look forward to the GTC in March, one analyst says
items.one_line: NVDA earnings prelude to guidance; sets tone for AI capex narrative.

narratives.verdict_text: **61.7%** of S&P 500 stocks trade above their 50-day moving average — a strong bull signal (score 4/5). VIX at **18.7** suggests options markets are pricing in calm. Full narrative generation requires the Claude API key to be configured.
narratives.vibe_desc:
Money is fleeing growth and risk—**XLK** and **XLY** are down 3.4% and 4.0% respectively over four weeks—while rotating hard into defensive sectors with steady cash flows, as **XLU** (+8.7%) and **XLP** (+7.7%) capture the flows that normally chase big tech gains. This rotation matters because it signals investors are pricing in either slower earnings growth or higher rates sticking around longer, which would starve the multiple expansion that fueled 2023's rally.

**A sharp decline in bond yields or a Fed pivot signal would reverse this immediately**—defensive sectors outperform when uncertainty is high, but the moment real rates fall, that same money rotates back into **XLK** and **XLY** in days, not weeks.

sector_why.XLK: Higher rates pressure valuations; tech outflows accelerating.
sector_why.XLF: Rising yields reduce NIM expansion; capital outflows.
sector_why.XLV: Defensive demand amid uncertainty; earnings resilience remains.
sector_why.XLY: Rate sensitivity hits discretionary demand; flows reversing.
sector_why.XLP: Inflation hedge appeal; staples inflows on safety.
sector_why.XLE: Oil strength; energy benefits from elevated commodity prices.
sector_why.XLU: Yield plays attractive; utilities capture inflation-hedging inflows.
sector_why.XLI: Infrastructure demand robust; cyclical revival with inflow support.
sector_why.XLB: Commodity strength; materials benefit from reflation trades.
sector_why.XLRE: Higher rates offset via diversification; steady inflows.
sector_why.XLC: Telecom weakness; dividend yield insufficient for outflows.
